subject: Photography
title: Self-Portraiture as Art
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Self-Portraiture as Art.

hook.text: The most available model is yourself. Self-portraiture has been a creative tool since photography began.

buildup.text: Self-portraits let photographers explore identity, emotion, and transformation with total creative control.

discovery.text: Cindy Sherman built an entire career on self-portraits where she's never herself â€” always a character.

twist.text: Selfies are self-portraits, but not all self-portraits are selfies. Art requires intention, not just a front camera.

climax.text: Self-portraiture forces introspection. You must decide: what version of myself do I want the world to see?

punchline.text: The most honest photograph is the one you take of yourself.

quiz.question: What distinguishes artistic self-portraiture from selfies?
options: Intentional creative vision and conceptual purpose
Always being in black and white
